info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 01 at 6:38PM PDT until September 01 at 9:45PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Nye County in south central Nevada... Northwestern Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 945 PM PDT. * At 638 PM PDT, local law enforcement reported flash flooding on Highway 160 east of Pahrump. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pahrump, Rainbow Canyon, Spring Mountains, Mt. Charleston, Red Rock Canyon, Mary Jane Falls Campground, Fletcher View Campground, Kyle Canyon Campground, Lovell Canyon Campground, Dolomite Campground, Mcwilliams Campground, Hilltop Campground, Mahogany Grove Campground, Willow Creek Campground, Indian Springs and Sandy Valley. This includes the following roads... Kyle Canyon Road between mile markers 1 and 15. Highway 95 in Clark County between mile marker 93 and 116. Lee Canyon Road between mile marker 1 and 17. State Route 160 in Clark County between mile marker 26 and 43. Deer Creek Road between mile markers 1 and 8. State Route 160 in Nye County between mile markers 1 and 14. This includes the following streams and drainages... Potosi Wash, Bonanza Wash, Cold Creek, Wheeler Wash, Lovell Wash and Keystone Wash. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
